description.value: Four tapered metal blades surround the central ring of a starknife, which can be thrown or used to stab opponents. Accelerated and lightspeed starknives have gas-powered jets that fire when the starknife is wielded. Solid auras surround the blades of a dimensional slice starknife, which are manufactured with cutting-edge metallurgic techniques. In a sintered starknife, the metal blades are replaced with compressed ceramic blades.

Popular among the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.races.3kLK4WKPqNvFTwIB]{Drow} on @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.setting.psZBx1kcx9pHsLrz]{Apostae}, this needle gun can deliver deadly @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JaRMioj4isNp7r1P.JournalEntryPage.ZaS9H4rwaFIQTUBC]{Poisons}. The weapon is so small you gain a +2 bonus to Sleight of Hand checks to hide it on your person.

modifiers.name: Nightarch needler
modifiers.notes: The weapon is so small you gain a +2 bonus to Sleight of Hand checks to hide it on your person.

description.value: Each viper has a signature @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JaRMioj4isNp7r1P.JournalEntryPage.ZaS9H4rwaFIQTUBC]{poison}, sometimes concocted with material from their own body. Each day they can produce three doses of this poison, which acts as an existing poison at a level lower than or equal to their CR. This poison can’t be sold and loses its toxicity after 24 hours.

Four tapered metal blades surround the central ring of a starknife, which can be thrown or used to stab opponents. Accelerated and lightspeed starknives have gas-powered jets that fire when the starknife is wielded. Solid auras surround the blades of a dimensional slice starknife, which are manufactured with cutting-edge metallurgic techniques. In a sintered starknife, the metal blades are replaced with compressed ceramic blades.

items.name: Viper Poison (Functions As Ungol Dust; 3 Doses)

description.value: Once per day, an astriapi can spend 10 minutes to produce a vial of magical honey. This honey functions as a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.wKVMw34GyIVXXs0w]{Serum of Healing, Mk 1}. At 5th level (or CR 5), the honey functions as a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.4HzMPv5UPcZYEdL1]{Serum of Healing, Mk 2}, and at 9th level (or CR 9),  it functions as a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.9Tgfgec4VaGkNHLR]{Serum of Healing, Mk 3}. Regardless of its level, the honey can’t be sold, and its magical properties expire after 24 hours, when it turns into mundane foodstuff.

modifiers.name: Skilled - diplo
modifiers.notes: Naturally eloquent and perceptive, aasimars gain +2 racial bonus to Diplomacy and Perception checks.

modifiers.name: Skilled - percep
modifiers.notes: Naturally eloquent and perceptive, aasimars gain +2 racial bonus to Diplomacy and Perception checks.

description.value:
These light metal shafts each have a pointed tip and a reservoir to hold toxins or other appropriate substances that are typically liquid or viscous. While most combatants rely on darts to deliver toxins to enemies, particularly desperate or overworked field medics sometimes employ darts to conveniently deliver antitoxins, healing serums, and other beneficial @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JaRMioj4isNp7r1P.JournalEntryPage.ZaS9H4rwaFIQTUBC]{Drugs} across a crowded battlefield. In these cases, medics often practice to improve their aim to ensure that this strategy is effective when employed.

Capacity: 25

In these cases, medics often practice to improve their aim to ensure that this strategy is effective when employed.

biography.value:
ASSASSINS

Assassins are skilled killers who excel in eliminating single targets. Often using various forms of stealth and subterfuge, they can pass between guards undetected and skillfully navigate traps to quickly dispatch their marked query. High‑profile corporations, cults, or criminal syndicates may employ assassins, but most work alone or as part of secretive guilds for hire and by contract.

Assassins work in the shadows, with some operating discreetly among the underbellies of society and others conducting their business while hiding in plain sight. Regardless of their methods, they’re valued for their ability to hide their tracks and maintain their employer’s anonymity. The most skilled assassins can take out high-profile figures without leaving any evidence for investigators to follow. The more difficult the job and the greater the prominence of the target, the higher the fee they command.

VIPER

Vipers rely on poison to take out their targets. They often craft their own toxins, using various aspects of their bodies, such as blood, tears, or chitin. They typically work alone. Vipers pride themselves on their calling cards, which can be used to trace assassinations back to them. Their ability to create novel venoms makes it difficult for natural defenses to resist the effects of the poison and for medical staff to treat those affected. Vipers are skilled bioengineers who are likely to work or have previously worked in laboratories. They see assassinations as a chance to show off their talent and research, and they revel in the fear instilled by their creations.
